objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) — primary organisation responsible for authoring/publishing the report (referenced throughout and listed as author in YARA metas); UK government cyber security authority whose findings and YARA rules are included in this report.

objects.name: URL serving DAMASCENED PEACOCK
objects.description: URL used in the infection chain to serve the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of the signed first-stage downloader Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of the signed first-stage downloader Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of the signed first-stage downloader Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK sample (XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK sample (XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK sample (XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll).

objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows observed in a late‑2024 spear‑phishing campaign against the UK Ministry of Defence. Implemented as a 32‑bit DLL with a single export (DllExport), it is the second of three stages: downloaded and launched by a signed first stage, runs inside that process, downloads a third-stage portable executable from its C2 and writes it to %LOCALAPPDATA%\KeyStore\KeyProv.dll, and achieves execution of the payload by registering a COM Hijack into explorer.exe and terminating explorer.exe to trigger the hijack. The sample uses XOR‑based string obfuscation (with redundant trailing bytes and a 4‑seed scheme), dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs via a unique API hashing algorithm, is proxy aware using WinHTTP over HTTP on port 8080, and beacons to domains such as apimonger[.]com. The malware is part of the RomCom family lineage and was observed being delivered via short‑lived redirecting links in spear‑phishing emails; the first stage is code‑signed (CN = FUTURICO LLC).

objects.name: rustyclaw
objects.description: Referenced as a related/preceding variant in the RomCom malware family. The report states DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a variant of RustyClaw and positions DAMASCENED PEACOCK as a stage between RustyClaw and DustyHammock; detailed functionality for RustyClaw is not provided in this report beyond lineage.

objects.name: snipbot
objects.description: Referenced as a related variant in the RomCom malware family; the report cites SnipBot as documented by Palo Alto (Unit42). The report does not provide detailed behaviors for SnipBot beyond its relation to the RomCom family.

objects.name: dustyhammock
objects.description: Referenced as the final third stage in the chain; DAMASCENED PEACOCK is responsible for downloading and executing the final stage, referred to as DustyHammock. Specific behaviors for DustyHammock are not detailed in this report.

objects.name: romcom
objects.description: The wider malware family that includes RustyClaw, SnipBot and related variants; DAMASCENED PEACOCK is described as part of this family lineage and as an interstitial staged downloader between RustyClaw and DustyHammock.

objects.name: UK Ministry of Defence (MOD)
objects.description: The targeted organisation in the observed spear‑phishing campaign; MOD detected the campaign and is cited as a reporting/affected organisation in the report.

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: Organisation named as the Subject (CN = FUTURICO LLC) in the code signing certificate used to sign the first‑stage downloader; the certificate information appears in Appendix 3 and indicates the first stage was code signed with a certificate listing FUTURICO LLC.

objects.name: GlobalSign
objects.description: GlobalSign nv‑sa — the certificate issuer/Certificate Authority (GlobalSign GCC R45 EV CodeSigning CA 2020) that issued the code signing certificate described in Appendix 3.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: Cisco Talos — security vendor referenced in the report as having documented RustyClaw (one of the related variants).

objects.name: Palo Alto Networks / Unit42
objects.description: Palo Alto Networks Unit42 — security vendor referenced in the report as having documented SnipBot (one of the related variants).

objects.name: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve
APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76"

    strings:

    $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1

C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3}
    condition:

    (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

and all of them
}

objects.name: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED
PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from
a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK
used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants
used to generate the hash."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ =
{8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9
??85F6}
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the original name and export
name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll"
        $ = "DllExport"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32‑bit or 64‑bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing
objects.description: The campaign delivered a signed first‑stage executable via links in spear‑phishing emails; DAMASCENED PEACOCK is ultimately downloaded and executed as part of this chain.

objects.name: User Execution: Link / Malicious File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email; execution relies on the user running the downloaded file (first stage launches DAMASCENED PEACOCK).

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the third stage it downloads by performing a COM Hijack into explorer.exe (modifies InprocServer32 registry entry and then triggers explorer.exe termination to cause the hijacked DLL to be loaded).

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings and implements inline string obfuscation to hide strings such as API names, domains and registry keys.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Dynamic API Resolution
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs (parsing the TEB/PEB and iterating kernel32.dll exports) to hide API usage; the API hashing algorithm includes multiple rotate operations, additions and multiplications.

objects.name: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing
objects.description: The first stage of the malware is code signed (certificate subject CN = FUTURICO LLC), allowing DAMASCENED PEACOCK to execute within a signed, malicious process and leverage that trust to evade detection.

objects.name: Masquerading
objects.description: The first stage masquerades as a benign PDF by using a filename and icon indicating a PDF, enabling user trust and facilitating execution of the malicious chain.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with its command and control server over HTTP (using WinHTTP APIs on port 8080) and sends an HTTP POST beacon requesting the appropriate update payload (get_update_manager32 or get_update_manager64) with a fixed 0xFFFF indicator followed by a payload name.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
